result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Domonic Lamar Grafton

defendant.name: Grafton, Domonic Lamar
defendant.address: 10006 West Fond Du Lac Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53224

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Domonic Lamar Grafton appeared by video.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Domonic Lamar Grafton.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Attorney Sylvan Jaspen informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable. Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court. Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 16; IN PERSON. Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw as Counsel for Defendant.  Received and Filed.  nk

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court with Domonic Lamar Grafton. Both parties appeared via zoom.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer Quentin Arnold, Milwaukee Police Department. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Domonic Lamar Grafton appeared by video.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Domonic Lamar Grafton.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defendant had technical issues with zoom appearance. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Court orders defendant to appear in person for the next court date.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Domonic Lamar Grafton in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Domonic Lamar Grafton appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Case adjourned due to State's Witness not being present. Defense moves to dismiss. Motion is taken under advisement. 
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Domonic Lamar Grafton in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Domonic Lamar Grafton in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Domonic Lamar Grafton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
